title: Sweet Potato Pie from Eagle Brand Recipe
description: This sweet potato pie with condensed milk is so easy that even first-time bakers can master it! It has a rich texture and a delicate blend of spices.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Trusted Brands: Recipes and Tips EAGLE BRAND® Sweet Potato Pie from Eagle Brand 4.7 (101) 83 Reviews 31 Photos This sweet potato pie with condensed milk has a rich texture and a delicate blend of spices. This Southern delicacy is easy enough for beginners to make. Submitted by Eagle brand Updated on December 16, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 31 31 31 31 Cook Time: 1 hr 5 mins Total Time: 1 hr 5 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 1 9-inch pie Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 pound sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks ¼ cup butter or margarine 1 (14 ounce) can EAGLE BRAND® Sweetened Condensed Milk 2 large eggs 1 teaspoon grated orange zest 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg ¼ teaspoon salt 1 (9 inch) pie shell, unbaked Directions Place sweet potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes. While the potatoes are cooking, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Drain potatoes and place into a large mixing bowl. Add butter and beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Mix in condensed milk, eggs, orange zest, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt until smooth; pour into pie shell. Bake in the preheated oven until the surface is firm except for a small spot in the center that will jiggle when the pan is gently shaken, about 40 minutes. Let cool before serving. I Made It Print 247 home cooks made it! name: Eagle brand
instructions: Place sweet potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water; bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes.;While the potatoes are cooking, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Drain potatoes and place into a large mixing bowl. Add butter and beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Mix in condensed milk, eggs, orange zest, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt until smooth; pour into pie shell.;Bake in the preheated oven until the surface is firm except for a small spot in the center that will jiggle when the pan is gently shaken, about 40 minutes. Let cool before serving.
